item.description:
our greatest "asset"                         

 

Okay, here I go again. The ill fated "Buns of Steel"  hike. The third times a charm.

East Beach in Charlestown or Ninigret Beach is a barrier beach and the first line of defense against storms that sweep in from Block Island Sound. All care and respect will be given to the dunes and plant life growing in the area. This area took a pounding from super storm Sandy but looks to be in pretty good shape.

This will be a 5 1/2 mile walk on the beach from the State parking lot at East Beach in Charlestown to the Charlestown Breach way and back. The breach way is the opening to Ninigret Pond, which we will explore somewhat as well. On a clear day this stretch of beach is beautiful with Block Island visible and nothing but open ocean beyond.

Your choice of footwear and clothing optional to protect against Sun and wind from the open water.

As always, the R I Hiking Clubs liability waiver applies to this hike. Extra water for hydration purposes is a must.

group.name: Rhode Island Hiking Club " Walks and Rambles "

item.name: A Day at the Beach
